articles.title: About this site
articles.contents:
This site tracks the duration of 2023 FBS college football games.
The goal is to track the duration of games and surface pace of play data. This data can be used to analyze recent rule changes.
Data sources
The data used on this site is provided by SportSource Analytics. You can find similar data by purchasing one of the data packages.
Historical data is corroborated using cfbfastR, stats.ncaa.org, and collegefootballdata.com.
Data definitions
duration of games are listed in minutes, and includes games between at least one FBS team
if a game includes a weather delay, it’s at the discretion of the scorekeeper if the delay is included in the duration
for example, Miami (OH) and UMass played a 410 minute game, however, there was a five hour delay

combined plays only tracks total offensive plays, so rushing and passing attempts, for games between two FBS teams.
play data does not include other play types (kickoff, punts, field goals, etc. )

combined drives includes all raw data and any “garbage” time drives for games between two FBS teams
How this site was built
This website was built by me, Chris Gallo. I write a weekly newsletter, Bless your chart, about college sports. If you have any questions, please send me an email.
The site is built using the Distill framework. All data manipulation is done using R programming language.

articles.title: Home
articles.description: Tracking the game duration of 2023 college football games.
articles.contents:
792 games have been played between FBS teams during the 2023 college football season.
Offenses are averaging 66.8 plays per game, a decrease of 1.9 plays from the previous season, and scoring an average of 26.7 points per game or 0.5 fewer points than last season.
FBS games are featuring an average of 24.1 combined drives, down by 0.4 drives from last season.
Games with at least one FBS team are lasting 3 hours and 23 minutes on average, four fewer minutes than last season.

articles.title: 2023 FBS Teams
articles.contents:
This table lists all 133 FBS teams. The table includes:
total number of games
plays per game
drives per game
points per game
minutes per game
The data includes “garbage” drives and games against FCS teams.
